1.description: The apache server has to be stopped in order to patch the system. This is done via: service apache2 stop

2.description: Update the whole linux server using the command: sudo apt-get update && apt-get upgrade -y

3.command: Quarantine or take offline potentially affected hosts
3.description: Isolate the affected systems to prevent further spread of the ransomware.

4.description: Reinstall the operating system on compromised hosts to ensure they are clean.

5.description: Create new account credentials to replace those that may have been compromised.

6.description: Collect and review artifacts such as running processes/services, unusual authentications, and recent network connections.

7.description: Report the compromise or phishing incident to CISA via CISA’s 24/7 Operations Center (report@cisa.gov or 888-282-0870). State, local, tribal, or territorial government entities can also report to MS-ISAC (SOC@cisecurity.org or 866-787-4722).

8.command: File a complaint with the FBI’s Internet Crime Complaint Center (IC3)
8.description: To report spoofing or phishing attempts (or to report that you’ve been a victim), file a complaint with the FBI’s Internet Crime Complaint Center (IC3), or contact your local FBI Field Office to report an incident.
